abstracts.cdata!:
Over the last five years the Ukrainian
            Government achieved essential successes in developing the
            agrarian sector of the economy. The assistance rendered by
            the World Bank since 1996 gave an appreciable impetus to the
            sector development. One of these financial aids concerned
            implementation of key economic reforms in the agrarian
            sector. To provide such aid, a project was developed
            entitled agriculture sector adjustment loan. Its resources
            were used to carry out land reform, to restructure
            agricultural enterprises, to privatize, and de-monopolize
            agro-industrial enterprises, as well as to liberalize
            internal and external trade, and to finance the critical
            import needs. The seeds development project helped improve
            the situation in the area of seed production and develop its
            competitiveness. The rural finance project objective was to
            facilitate the development of effectively operating and
            competitive rural regions, and to improve the living
            standards of the rural population. In June 2003, the World
            Bank approved the decision to extend a loan in the amount of
            United States (U.S.) 195 million dollars for implementing
            the rural land titling and cadastre development project for
            Ukraine. The World Bank supported land reform as a priority
            component of economic transformations that are taking place
            in the Ukrainian agrarian sector. The activities envisaged
            by the project are aimed at a fair distribution of land
            plots among farmers, consolidating of their ownership rights
            to land by issuing respective state land titles on a
            free-of-charge basis, as well as the development of a land
            lease market, which is to contribute to improving the living
            standards of the rural population. The project will focus
            much attention to informing the population on the work
            carried out and the significance of land reform on the
            whole. Furthermore, additional funds will be allocated to
            purchase required equipment for agrarian universities in the
            cities of Odesa, Lviv, Kharkiv, and Kyiv.

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Agriculture Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated as
            satisfactory. Key lesson learned include: 1) It is important
            to build stable base for reform and anticipate potential
            changes in leadership. A core group of articulate
            agricultural policy analysts and working group leaders is
            key to generating and sustaining momentum in an agricultural
            reform program and maintaining the Government's level
            of attention to politically charged agricultural reform
            issues. 2) It is realistic to recognize the limits of the
            policy instruments included under the conditionalities. 3)
            It is key to pay close attention to the time frame and lags
            of policies. It was unrealistic to believe that the
            implementation of the sets of conditionalities aimed at farm
            restructuring and agro-industrial privatization and
            demonopolization would be able in a year and a half's
            time to substantially reorient land tenure, alter corporate
            governance, and cause newly formed enterprises to exhibit
            independence of their former national and regional
            supervising monopolies. 4) Considerable attention should be
            accorded to the political economy of change. An explicit
            analysis should be made of: a) the receptivity of major
            political groups to change; b) public education and outreach
            programs required to reach interested stakeholders; and c)
            elements of the project design that could appeal to stakeholders.

5084117.majtheme: Economic management,Environment and natural resource management,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Agriculture Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan (Ag SECAL) is to support the growth of a
            market-based agricultural system. This will be achieved by
            instituting agricultural and trade reforms aimed at
            increasing market competition, encouraging private ownership
            and investment in land and other productive assets, and
            providing short term balance-of-payments support for
            financing critical imports. The reform program that the Ag
            SECAL support will improve agricultural terms of trade,
            increase input flows to farms, expand agricultural exports,
            and increase the efficiency of farm management. The Ag SECAL
            encompasses policy reforms and balance of-payments
            financing. The policy conditionally will focus on the
            agricultural sector and address the following: a) reduction
            in the export restrictions allowing increased access to
            export market; b) development of a well functioning land
            market; and c) enabling privatization and demonopolization
            of existing agribusiness firms and encouraging new entrants.
            The negative short-term adjustments associated with these
            policy changes will be cushioned by balance-of-payments
            financing. The funds provided under this component of the Ag
            SECAL will be used to finance general imports. The funds
            will be channeled through the National Bank of Ukraine, and
            allocated through the established market system for
            auctioning foreign exchange. While balance-of-payments
            support is not expected to be targeted at financing imports
            for the agricultural sector it is expected to improve the
            availability of agricultural inputs.
